tips: Similar triangles have equal corresponding angles and proportional corresponding sides
The scale factor is the ratio of any pair of corresponding sides
All corresponding sides must have the same scale factor for triangles to be similar
When finding missing sides, use the scale factor from known corresponding sides
Always check that the scale factor is consistent across all corresponding sides
Remember that similar triangles maintain their shape but change size proportionally
